etymologies: late 16th century: from Portuguese, from Tupi acajú, cajú

definitions: an edible kidney-shaped nut, rich in oil and protein, which is roasted and shelled before it can be eaten. Oil is extracted from the shells and used as a lubricant and insecticide and in the production of plastics.
shortDefinitions: edible kidney-shaped nut, rich in oil and protein, which is roasted and shelled before it can be eaten

definitions: a bushy tropical American tree related to the mango, bearing cashew nuts singly at the tip of each swollen fruit.

notes.text: Anacardium occidentale, family Anacardiaceae (the cashew family)

shortDefinitions: bushy tropical American tree related to mango
